turn.2: XDR2 DRAM XDR2 DRAM was a proposed type of dynamic random-access memory that was offered by Rambus.
turn.4: It was announced on July 7, 2005 and the specification for which was released on March 26, 2008.
turn.5: What are some of the features?
turn.6: Rambus has designed XDR2 as an evolution of, and the successor to, XDR DRAM.
turn.8: XDR2 DRAM is intended for use in high-end graphics cards and networking equipment.
turn.9: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.10: As a fabless semiconductor company, Rambus only produces a design; it must make deals with memory manufacturers to produce XDR2 DRAM chips, and there has been a notable lack of interest in doing so.
turn.11: What are some of the features?
turn.12: In addition to a higher clock rate (up to 800 MHz), the XDR2 differential data lines transfer data at 16 times the system clock rate, transferring 16 bits per pin per clock cycle.
